explanation: Load Stata's built-in auto dataset into memory, replacing any existing data.
Import a CSV file named myfile.csv  and replace any data currently in memory.
Load a Stata .dta file called myData.dta  into memory, replacing existing data.
Display variable names, types, formats, and labels for the dataset in memory.
Show mean, standard deviation, min, and max for variables price and mpg.
Provide detailed univariate statistics for price, including percentiles and kurtosis.
Show variable types, labels, unique values, and summary statistics for make and price.
Display a quick view of mpg distribution and number of missing or zero values.
Produce a one-way frequency table for rep78 including missing values.
Create a two-way table of foreign by rep78 and report chi-square and expected counts.
